name: Phase Biolabs
headline: We make carbon negative chemicals from CO2 using fermentation
description:
Phase Biolabs makes carbon negative solvents and electro-fuels from carbon dioxide (CO2) using fermentation.

You can read more about what we are building in our Hacker News article: https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=30557288

Phase Biolabs is also supported by Bill Gate's Breakthrough Energy Foundation via their Innovator Fellowship program.

founders.name: David Ortega, Founder
founders.description: Building bio-based solutions for the climate crisis, specifically working on industrial decarbonisation.

generated_description:
**Phase Biolabs: Turning CO2 into Opportunity**

Founded in 2020 and based in Nottingham, UK, Phase Biolabs is on a mission that feels both ambitious and remarkably necessary: they’re converting carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions into carbon-negative chemicals and fuels through fermentation. Imagine a world where emissions aren’t just a problem to mitigate but a resource to exploit. That’s the innovative vision they’re pursuing. 

As part of Y Combinator's Winter 2022 batch, Phase Biolabs has quickly gained traction, even securing support from Bill Gates' Breakthrough Energy Foundation through their Innovator Fellowship program. With a nimble team of around 10 talents—engineers, scientists, and creative minds—they’re laying the groundwork for a significant impact in the climate sector.

At the heart of their process is gas fermentation, where H2 and CO2 are fed into specially engineered microbes. These microbes "eat" the gases, producing valuable chemicals and electro-fuels. It’s a brilliant twist of biotechnology that essentially aims to end reliance on fossil fuels by retrofitting existing setups to work with any CO2 source. Their goal? Upcycle 1 gigaton of CO2 by 2050. 

The company is not just about big ideas; they’re looking for like-minded individuals to join their mission. The call to arms is clear: “We need your help to achieve our goal and save the planet from harmful emissions.” Interested individuals can check out job opportunities through their website.

If you want to dive deeper into what Phase Biolabs is building, you can also find insights in their [Hacker News article](https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=30557288) or visit their [official website](https://www.phasebiolabs.com/) to learn more about their solutions and technology.

In a world seeking sustainable solutions, Phase Biolabs stands out not just for its innovation, but for its commitment to tackling climate change head-on by transforming waste into opportunity.
